meanings.definition: An instrument for measuring speed or velocity.
meanings.sent1: The velocimeter showed the car's speed.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used the velocimeter to measure the velocity of the object.
meanings.sent3: The velocimeter seemed to have a mind of its own, always knowing how fast things were moving.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a velocimeter, quickly assessing the speed of everything around her.
meanings.sent5: The velocimeter beeped loudly as the train zoomed past, indicating its incredible speed.

meanings.definition: A device used to determine the rate of motion.
meanings.sent1: I relied on the velocimeter to calculate the rate of motion of the vehicle.
meanings.sent2: The velocimeter displayed the rate of motion of the roller coaster accurately.
meanings.sent3: The velocimeter and the stopwatch had a race to see who could determine motion quicker.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a velocimeter, always analyzing the rate of motion in his surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The velocimeter's needle danced back and forth, indicating the changing rate of motion.
